page.title: 09Fort Purbrook
page.content: Built in the 1860's as part of Lord Palmerston's Portsmouth defences against the French. The guns pointed away from Portsmouth to the North to protect the city from inland attack. During the world wars it was used as a barracks. In 1980 it was taken over by the City Council in a derelict state. Youth Training Scheme members and volunteers have restored part of it which is now used as an activity centre for young people. It offers opportunity for a residential stay, archery, craft, judo, karate, camping and other outdoor pursuits. In the underground tunnels used for orienteering there is supposed to be a ghost.
